sen.j: 琵琶湖（びわこ）は、滋賀県にある湖。
sen.e: Lake Biwa is a lake in Shiga Prefecture.
Lake Biwa is a lake in Shiga Prefecture.
Lake Biwa is a lake in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本で日本一の一覧の面積を誇る。
sen.e: It is the largest lake in Japan.
It is the largest lake in Japan.
It is the largest lake in Japan.

sen.j: 湖沼水質保全特別措置法指定湖沼。
sen.e: A lake designated by Law Concerning Special Measures for Conservation of Lake Water Quality
The lake is designated under the Law Concerning Special Measures for Conservation of Lake Water Quality.
The lake is designated under the Law Concerning Special Measures for Conservation of Lake Water Quality.

sen.j: ラムサール条約登録湿地。
sen.e: A wetland registered under the Ramsar Convention
The wetlands are registered under the Ramsar Convention.
The wetlands are registered under the Ramsar Convention.

sen.j: 河川法上は一級水系「淀川水系」に属する一級河川であり、正式名称は「一級河川琵琶湖」として扱われる。
sen.e: In the River Act, Lake Biwa is a class A river belonging to the first class river of the Yodo River system, and is officially described as Lake Biwa, the class A river (一級河川琵琶湖).
In the River Act, Lake Biwa is a class A river belonging to the first-class rivers of the Yodo River system, and is officially described as "Lake Biwa, the class A river (一級河川琵琶湖)."
In the River Act, Lake Biwa is a class A river belonging to the first-class rivers of 'the Yodo-gawa River system,' and is officially described as 'Lake Biwa, a class A river (一級河川琵琶湖).'

sen.j: 地理
sen.e: Geography
Geography
Geography

sen.j: 滋賀県の面積の6分の1を占め、流れ出る水は瀬田川、宇治川、淀川と名前を変えて、大阪湾（瀬戸内海）へ至る。
sen.e: Lake Biwa occupies one-sixth of the Shiga prefecture's land area, and the water flowing out of the lake flows into Osaka Bay in the Seto Inland Sea through the Seta River, whose name changes to the Uji River and later the Yodo River along the way.

Lake Biwa occupies one-sixth of Shiga Prefecture's land area, and the water flowing from the lake flows into Osaka Bay in the Seto Inland Sea through the Seta-gawa River, whose name changes to the Uji-gawa River and later the Yodo-gawa River.

Lake Biwa occupies one-sixth of Shiga Prefecture's land area, and the water flowing from the lake flows into Osaka Bay in the Seto Inland Sea through the Seta-gawa River, whose name changes to the Uji-gawa River and later the Yodo-gawa River.

sen.j: また、湖水を京都市や淀川流域の水道水として使用するために、琵琶湖疏水が京都に流れている。
sen.e: Lake Biwa Canal runs to Kyoto, supplying the lake water for drinking to Kyoto City and the areas along the Yodo River.
Lake Biwa Canal runs to Kyoto, supplying lake water for drinking to Kyoto City and the areas along the Yodo River.
Lake Biwa Canal runs to Kyoto, supplying lake water for drinking to Kyoto City and the areas along the Yodo-gawa River.

sen.j: 最狭部に架かる琵琶湖大橋を挟んだ北側部分を北湖（太湖）、南側部分を南湖と呼び、水質や水の流れなどが異なる。
sen.e: The part of the lake to the north of the Biwako Ohashi Bridge, which was built at the narrowest point, is called the Northern Lake or 'Taiko,' and the part to the south is called the Southern Lake, and the water quality and water flow differ between them.

The part of the lake to the north of the Biwako Ohashi Bridge, which was built at the narrowest point, is called the Northern Lake or 'Taiko,' while the part to the south is called the Southern Lake; accordingly, the water quality and water flow differ between them.

The part of the lake to the north of the Biwako Ohashi Bridge, which was built at the narrowest point, is called the Northern Lake or 'Taiko,' while the part to the south is called the Southern Lake; accordingly, the water quality and water flow differ between them.

sen.j: 琵琶湖を取り巻く各自治体は、大きく湖南・湖東・湖北・湖西に分けられる（湖南から甲賀を分けることもある）。
sen.e: The municipalities surrounding Lake Biwa are roughly classified as Konan, Koto, Kohoku, and Kosai (and sometimes Koka too, separated from Konan).
The municipalities surrounding Lake Biwa are roughly classified as Konan, Koto, Kohoku and Kosai (and sometimes Koka too, as seen separately from Konan).

The municipalities surrounding Lake Biwa are roughly classified as Konan (south of the lake), Koto (east of the lake), Kohoku (north of the lake) and Kosai (west of the lake)(and sometimes Koka too, as seen separately from Konan).
sen.cmt: 湖南・湖東・湖北・湖西にそれぞれ方角の英訳を付けました。

sen.j: これらの区分については「滋賀県地域」を参照すること。
sen.e: See Districts in Shiga Prefecture on this classification.
See "Districts in Shiga Prefecture" for details regarding this classification.
See 'Districts in Shiga Prefecture' for the details regarding this classification.

sen.j: 湖を取り囲む山地からの流れが源流で、京阪神の水瓶という機能も担っている。
sen.e: The water of Lake Biwa originates from the surrounding mountains, and the lake functions as the 'water jug' of the Kyoto-Osaka-Kobe area.
The water of Lake Biwa originates from the surrounding mountains, so the lake functions as the 'water jug' of the Kyoto-Osaka-Kobe area.
The water of Lake Biwa originates from the surrounding mountains, so the lake functions as a water reservoir for the Kyoto-Osaka-Kobe area.

sen.j: また、古くから水上交通路としても利用されており、明治時代に鉄道が開通するまでは、京都市・大阪市から東山道・北陸地方への物資輸送に利用されていた。
sen.e: Moreover, the lake had been used for water transport from ancient times, and until the railroad opened in the Meiji period, had been used to carry goods from Kyoto City and Osaka City to Tosando and the Hokuriku region.

Moreover, the lake has been used for water transport since ancient times, and until the railroad opened in the Meiji period it had been used to carry goods from Kyoto City and Osaka City to Tosando and the Hokuriku region.

Moreover, the lake has been used for water transport since ancient times, and until the railroad opened in the Meiji period it had been used to carry goods from Kyoto City and Osaka City to Tosando and the Hokuriku region.

sen.j: なお「急がば回れ」という諺は、現在の草津市と大津市の間を結んでいた「矢橋の渡し」を詠んだ和歌が語源となっている。
sen.e: The Japanese proverb 'isogaba maware' meaning 'more haste, less speed' originated from the waka written about a ferry 'Yahashi no Watashi' connecting present-day Kusatsu City and Otsu City.

The Japanese proverb 'isogaba maware,' meaning 'more haste, less speed,' originated from the waka written about a ferry called the 'Yahashi no Watashi' connecting present-day Kusatsu City and Otsu City.

The Japanese proverb 'isogaba maware (more haste, less speed)' originated from a waka that was written about a ferry called the 'Yahashi no Watashi' connecting the present-day Kusatsu City and Otsu City.

sen.j: 東京湾中等潮位(T.P.)基準で+84.371 m、大阪湾平均干潮位(O.P.)基準で+85.614 mの高さが琵琶湖基準水位(B.S.L.)と定められており、「琵琶湖の水位」とはB.S.L.を±0 mとした水位のことをいう。
sen.e: The Biwako Basic Surface Water Level (B.S.L) is set at T.P. (Tokyo Peil) +84.371 m and O.P. (Osaka Peil) +85.614 m, and 'the water level of Lake Biwa' is relative to the B.S.L.: above or below the B.S.L (0 m).

The Biwako Basic Surface Water Level (BSL) is set at T.P. (Tokyo Peil) +84.371 m and O.P. (Osaka Peil) +85.614 m, and 'the water level of Lake Biwa' is relative to the BSL: above or below the BSL (0 m).

The Biwako Basic Surface Water Level (BSL) is set at T.P. (Tokyo Peil) +84.371 m and O.P. (Osaka Peil) +85.614 m, and 'the water level of Lake Biwa' is relative to the B.S.L., being either above or below the B.S.L. (0 m).

sen.j: B.S.L.は、1874年(明治7年）に鳥居川観測点において「これ以上水位が下がることはない」と判断された点として定められたものであるが、その後、瀬田川の改修によって流出量が多くなったことなどにより、水位がB.S.L.以下になることが多くなった。
sen.e: The B.S.L was set at the observation point of the Torii River in 1874, believing the water level was the lowest possible at that time, but later the water levels of Lake Biwa often reached below the B.S.L partly due to the improvement of the Seta River which caused more water to flow out from the lake.

The BSL was set at the observation point of the Torii River in 1874, in the assumption that the water level was the lowest possible at that time; however, later the water levels of Lake Biwa often went below the BSL, partly due to the improvement of the Seta River, which caused more water to flow out of the lake.

The B.S.L. was set at the observation point of the Torii-gawa River in 1874, in the assumption that 'the water level was the lowest possible' at that time; however, later the water levels of Lake Biwa often went below the B.S.L., partly due to the improvement of the Seta-gawa River, which caused more water to flow out of the lake.

sen.j: 現在では、B.S.L.の値がおおむね満水位となるように水位の調整が行われている。
sen.e: Today, the water level is adjusted to keep roughly the B.S.L the high water level.
Today, the water level is adjusted in order to maintain the BSL as the approximate high-water level.
Today, the water level is adjusted in order to maintain the B.S.L. at the approximate high-water level.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 琵琶湖が形成された時期は、約400万年～600万年前で、現在の三重県伊賀市平田に地殻変動によってできた構造湖であった（大山田湖）。
sen.e: Lake Biwa was a tectonic lake (Lake Oyamada) formed approximately four to six million years ago around present-day Hirata in Iga City, Mie Prefecture as a result of tectonic movement.

Lake Biwa originated as a tectonic lake (Lake Oyamada); it formed approximately four to six million years ago around the present-day Hirata in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, as the result of tectonic movement.

Lake Biwa originated as a tectonic lake (Lake Oyamada); it formed approximately four to six million years ago around the present-day Hirata in Iga City, Mie Prefecture, as the result of tectonic movement.

sen.j: これが次第に北へ移動し、比良山系によって止められる形で現在の琵琶湖の位置に至ったという。
sen.e: Lake Biwa gradually moved northward, and being blocked by the Hira Mountain System, the lake finally reached its current position.
Lake Biwa gradually moved northward until it reached its current position, being blocked by the Hira Mountains.
Lake Biwa gradually moved northward until it reached its current position, being blocked by the Hira Mountains.

sen.j: 大山田湖以前、現在の琵琶湖の位置には山（古琵琶湖山脈）があり、鈴鹿山脈は未だ隆起せず、今日の琵琶湖東南部の河川は伊勢湾へ流れていた。
sen.e: Before Lake Oyamada was formed, there had been mountains (古琵琶湖山脈) in the current location of Lake Biwa; the Suzuka Mountains had not been raised up, and the rivers in the southeast of the present-day Lake Biwa had flowed out to Ise Bay.

Before Lake Oyamada was formed, there had been mountains (古琵琶湖山脈) in the current location of Lake Biwa; the Suzuka Mountains had not yet risen, and the rivers in the southeast of the present-day Lake Biwa flowed out to Ise Bay.

Before Lake Oyamada was formed, there had been mountains (古琵琶湖山脈) in the current location of Lake Biwa; the Suzuka Mountains had not yet risen, and the rivers in the southeast of the present-day Lake Biwa flowed out to Ise Bay.

sen.j: それを裏付けるように、鈴鹿山脈の主要な地質は礫岩である。
sen.e: This is evidenced by the fact the Suzuka Mountains are composed mainly of the layer of conglomerate.
This is evidenced by the fact that the Suzuka Mountains consist mainly of a layer of conglomerate.
This is evidenced by the fact that the Suzuka Mountains consist mainly of a layer of conglomerate.

sen.j: また、琵琶湖に流入する最大の川で、東南に位置する野洲川は、当時西方ではなく、東方へ流れていたという。
sen.e: In addition, the Yasu River, the largest river in the southeast to flow into Lake Biwa, is knows to have flowed eastward, not westward, at that time.
Additionally, the Yasu River, as the largest river in the southeast to flow into Lake Biwa, is known to have flowed eastward, not westward, at that time.
Additionally, the Yasu-gawa River, as the largest river in the southeast to flow into Lake Biwa, is known to have flowed eastward, not westward, at that time.

sen.j: 世界の湖の中でも、バイカル湖やタンガニーカ湖に次いで3番目に古い古代湖であると目されている。
sen.e: Lake Biwa is regarded as the third oldest ancient lake in the world after Lake Baikal and Lake Tanganyika.
Lake Biwa is regarded as the third-oldest ancient lake in the world after Lake Baikal and Lake Tanganyika.
Lake Biwa is regarded as the third-oldest ancient lake in the world after Lake Baikal and Lake Tanganyika.

sen.j: 縄文時代や弥生時代から交通路としても利用され、丸木舟なども出土している。
sen.e: The lake had been used for water transport since the Jomon period and the Yayoi period, and items such as dugouts had been found.
The lake had been used for water transport since the Jomon and Yayoi periods, and items such as dugouts have been found.
The lake had been used for water transport since the Jomon and Yayoi periods, and items such as dugouts have been found.

sen.j: 古代には、都から近い淡水の海として近淡海（ちかつあわうみ、単に淡海とも。
sen.e: In ancient times, the lake was called Chikatsu-awa-umi (or simply Awaumi) as the nearest 'freshwater sea' from the capital.
In ancient times the lake was called "Chikatsu-awa-umi (or simply Awaumi)" as the nearest 'freshwater sea' from the capital.
In ancient times the lake was called Chikatsu-awa-umi (or simply Awaumi) as the body of freshwater nearest to the capital.

sen.j: 古事記では「淡海の湖」（あふみのうみ）と記載）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: In the Kojiki, it was described as Afumi-no-umi
In the Kojiki, it was described as "Afumi-no-umi."
It was described in the Kojiki as 'Afumi-no-umi.'

sen.j: 近淡海に対し、都から遠い淡水の海として浜名湖が遠淡海（とおつあわうみ）と呼ばれ、それぞれが「近江国（おうみのくに、現在の滋賀県）」と遠江国（とおとうみのくに、現在の静岡県西部）の語源になった。
sen.e: Lake Hamana was called Totsu-awaumi as a freshwater sea far away from the capital compared to Lake Biwa, and the names of Omi Province (present-day Shiga Prefecture) and Totomi Province (the west of present-day Shizuoka Prefecture) each originated from those old lake names.

Lake Hamana was called "Totsu-awaumi" as a freshwater sea far away from the capital compared to Lake Biwa, and the names of Omi Province (the present-day Shiga Prefecture) and Totomi Province (the west of present-day Shizuoka Prefecture) originated from those old lake names.

Lake Hamana was called Totsu-awa-umi as a freshwater sea far away from the capital compared to Lake Biwa, and the names of 'Omi Province (the present-day Shiga Prefecture)' and Totoumi Province (the west of present-day Shizuoka Prefecture) originated from those old lake names.

sen.j: 別名の鳰海（におのうみ）は、近江国の歌枕である。
sen.e: Nionoumi, another name for Lake Biwa, is a Utamakura, a word or phrase used in waka specifically for a certain theme, in this case, Omi Province.
Nionoumi, another name for Lake Biwa, is an utamakura, a word or phrase used in waka specifically in the context of a certain theme, which in this case is Omi Province.
Nionoumi, another name for Lake Biwa, is an utamakura, a word or phrase used in waka specifically in the context of a certain theme, which in this case is Omi Province.

sen.j: 天智天皇により、一時は琵琶湖西岸に大津京が置かれた。
sen.e: There was a time that Emperor Tenchi established Otsu-kyo on the western shore of Lake Biwa.
There was a time when Emperor Tenchi had established Otsu-kyo on the western shore of Lake Biwa.
There was a time when the Emperor Tenchi had established Otsu-kyo on the western shore of Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: "Emperor Tenchi" -> "the Emperor Tenchi" に変更しました。

sen.j: 測量技術が発達し湖の形が琵琶に似ていることが判った江戸時代中期以降、琵琶湖という名称が定着した。
sen.e: After the middle of the Edo period when survey techniques were developed and the shape of the lake turned out to look like a Japanese lute, the name of the lake became widely known as Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 英辞郎 on the WEB英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: After the middle of the Edo period, when land-surveying techniques were developed and the shape of the lake turned out to look like a Japanese lute, the name of the lake became widely known as Lake Biwa.

After the middle of the Edo period, when land-surveying techniques were developed and the shape of the lake turned out to look like a Japanese lute, the name of the lake became widely known as Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 琵琶湖は、若狭湾沿岸からの年貢の輸送路としても利用されており、湖上で賊に襲撃された記録なども残されている。
sen.e: The lake was used for water transport of annual tribute from Wakasa Bay, and some records show that ships were attacked by pirates on the lake.
The lake was used for the water transport of annual tributes from Wakasa Bay, and records show that ships were attacked by pirates on the lake.
The lake was used for the water transport of annual tributes from Wakasa Bay, and records show that ships were attacked by pirates on the lake.

sen.j: 湖西には、大津から若狭国へ向かう西近江路や若狭街道、京都から琵琶湖などを経て今庄町から北陸道につながる北国街道などの各種交通路が整備された。
sen.e: Various transport routes were constructed to the west of the lake: for example, the Nishi-omi-ji Road and the Wakasa Kaido Road stretching from Otsu to Wakasa Province, and the Hokkoku Kaido Road linking Kyoto and, via Lake Biwa, Imajo-cho where the road connected to the Hokurikudo Road.

Various transport routes were constructed to the west of the lake, such as the Nishi-omi-ji Road and the Wakasa Kaido Road stretching from Otsu to Wakasa Province, and the Hokkoku Kaido Road linking Kyoto and, via Lake Biwa, Imajo-cho, where the road connected to the Hokurikudo Road.

Various transport routes were constructed to the west of the lake, such as the Nishi-omi-ji Road and the Wakasa Kaido Road stretching from Otsu to Wakasa Province, and the Hokkoku Kaido Road linking Kyoto and, via Lake Biwa, Imajo-cho, where the road connected to the Hokurikudo Road.

sen.j: 湖上交通による荷物の輸送も行われており、大津や堅田などは港湾都市として発達した。
sen.e: Water transport via Lake Biwa was also used to carry goods, and places such as Otsu and Katata developed as a major port.
Water transport via Lake Biwa was also used to carry goods, and places such as Otsu and Katata developed as key ports.
Water transport via Lake Biwa was also used to carry goods, and places such as Otsu and Katata developed as key ports.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代には、豊臣秀吉は、大津の船持に大津百艘船を整備し、観音寺の船奉行の支配下に置かれ、特権を与えられて保護された。
sen.e: In the Azuchi Momoyama period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI set up Otsu-hyakuso-sen (literally meaning 'one hundred ships in Otsu') for funamochi (owners of a boat) in Otsu, put them under the control of the ship superintendent KANNONJI, and protected them with special privileges.

In the Azuchi Momoyama period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI set up Otsu-hyakuso-sen (literally meaning 'one hundred ships in Otsu') for funamochi (owners of boats) in Otsu, put them under the control of the ship superintendent KANNONJI and protected them with special privileges.

In the Azuchi Momoyama period, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI set up Otsu-hyakuso-sen (a hundred ships in Otsu) for funamochi (owners of boats) in Otsu, put them under the control of the ship superintendent at Kannon-ji Temple and protected them with special privileges.

sen.j: 近世になると、大津は松原や米原市など他の港と対立し、江戸時代には松原、米原、長浜市が「彦根藩三湊」として井伊氏の保護を受けた。
sen.e: In the early modern period, Otsu was opposed to other ports including Matsubara and Maibara City, and in the Edo period, Matsubara, Maibara, and Nagahama City as `Hikone-han-san-minato' (three ports in Hakone-han) was protected by the Ii clan.
sen.cmt: http://www.city.nagahama.shiga.jp/http://longlife.city.hikone.shiga.jp/museum/letter/45.html彦根三湊が一派的なようです。
sen.e: In the early modern era, Otsu was opposed to other ports including Matsubara and Maibara City; but during the Edo period, Matsubara, Maibara and Nagahama City as `Hikone-han-san-minato' (three ports in Hakone-han) were protected by the Ii clan.

In the early modern era, Otsu was opposed to other ports such as Matsubara and Maibara City; but during the Edo period Matsubara, Maibara and Nagahama City as `Hikone-han-san-minato' (three ports in Hikone-han) were protected by the Ii clan.

sen.j: 琵琶湖が淀川となって大阪湾に流れる位置から、京都が首都だった時代には、若狭湾で陸揚げされた物資が、琵琶湖の湖上交通で京都や大坂に輸送されていた。
sen.e: Goods unloaded at the ports in Wakasa Bay were carried by water transport via Lake Biwato to Kyoto and Osaka from the point where the river from Lake Biwa became the Yodo River during those periods when Kyoto was the capital.
sen.cmt: 「琵琶湖が淀川」を「琵琶湖からの川が淀川」と補いました。
sen.e: Goods unloaded at the ports in Wakasa Bay were carried by water transport via Lake Biwato to Kyoto and Osaka from the point where the river from Lake Biwa became the Yodo River during those periods when Kyoto was the capital.

Goods unloaded at the ports in Wakasa Bay were transported via Lake Biwa to Kyoto and Osaka from the point where the river from Lake Biwa running to Osaka Bay became the Yodo-gawa River during those periods when Kyoto was the capital.
sen.cmt: 大阪湾に流れる 追加 Biwato → Biwa

sen.j: 湖上を介した水運は陸上交通の発達によって斜陽となったが、高度経済成長期には琵琶湖から運河を掘削して日本海や太平洋・瀬戸内海を結ぶ運河構想が持ち上がった。
sen.e: Water transport via the lake declined due to the development of road transport, but the plan to build canals from Lake Biwa to the Sea of Japan, the Pacific Ocean, and the Seto Inland Sea was conceived during the period of high economic growth.

Water transport via the lake declined due to the development of road transport, but the plan to build canals from Lake Biwa to the Sea of Japan, the Pacific Ocean and the Seto Inland Sea were conceived during a period of high economic growth.

Water transport via the lake declined due to the development of road transport, but the plan to build canals from Lake Biwa to the Sea of Japan, the Pacific Ocean and the Seto Inland Sea were conceived during a period of high economic growth.

sen.j: 当初は、琵琶湖から日本海と瀬戸内海を結ぶ阪敦運河構想を北栄造福井県知事が調整し始めたが、当時の平田佐矩四日市市長が熱心だったこともあり、福井県・滋賀県・岐阜県・愛知県・三重県、名古屋市・敦賀市・四日市市の間で、自民党副総裁の大野伴睦を会長に、総工費2500億円～3500億円に及ぶ若狭湾～琵琶湖～伊勢湾を結ぶ運河の建設期成同盟が結成された。
sen.e: At first, the governor of Fukui Prefecture, Eizo KITA, accommodated the plan '阪敦運河構想' to connect the Sea of Japan and the Seto Inland via Lake Biwa, but, because Sukenori HIRATA, the mayor of Yokkaichi City at that time, was keen on the plan, the alliance for the construction of the canal to connect Wakasa Bay and Ise Bay via Lake Biwa (the total cost of 250 to 350 trillion yen) was formed with Bamboku ONO, the Vice President of the Liberal Democratic Party, as chairman, among Fukui Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture, Gifu Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Nagoya City, Tsuruga City, and Yokkaichi City.

Initially, the governor of Fukui Prefecture, Eizo KITA, accommodated the plan '阪敦運河構想' to connect the Sea of Japan and the Seto Inland via Lake Biwa, but because Sukenori HIRATA, who was then the mayor of Yokkaichi City, was keen on the plan, the alliance for the construction of the canal to connect Wakasa Bay and Ise Bay via Lake Biwa (at a total cost of 250 to 350 trillion yen) was formed with Bamboku ONO, the Vice President of the Liberal Democratic Party, as chairman, among Fukui Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture, Gifu Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Nagoya City, Tsuruga City and Yokkaichi City.

Initially, the governor of Fukui Prefecture, Eizo KITA, accommodated the plan 'Framework on Hanko Canal' (阪敦運河構想) to connect the Sea of Japan and the Seto Inland Sea via Lake Biwa, but because Sukenori HIRATA, who was then the mayor of Yokkaichi City, was keen on the plan, the alliance for the construction of the canal to connect Wakasa Bay and Ise Bay via Lake Biwa (at a total cost of 250 to 350 billion yen) was formed with Banboku ONO, the Vice President of the Liberal Democratic Party, as chairman, among Fukui Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture, Gifu Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, Nagoya City, Tsuruga City and Yokkaichi City.
sen.cmt: Seto Inland Seaとしました trillion →billion 'Framework on Hanko Canal' (阪敦運河構想) と補足しました。

sen.j: しかし、大野自民党副総裁、平田四日市市長の死去と、北福井県知事、畑守敦賀市長が相次いで落選するなど、推進の中心人物を失い、1970年には中部圏開発整備本部が調査の打ち切りを発表した。）。
sen.e: In 1970, however, headquarters of Chubu Area Development and Improvement (中部圏開発整備本部) announced the termination of the survey after the loss of key members of the alliance: the Vice President of the Liberal Democratic Party, ONO, and the mayor of Yokkaichi City, HIRATA, both passed away, and the governor of Fukui Prefecture, KITA, and the mayor of Tsuruga City, 畑守, continually lost in the election.

However, in 1970 the headquarters of Chubu Area Development and Improvement (中部圏開発整備本部) announced the termination of the survey after the loss of key members of the alliance: ONO, the vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party, and HIRATA, the mayor of Yokkaichi City, had both passed away, while KITA, the governor of Fukui Prefecture, and the mayor of Tsuruga City, 畑守, continually lost in the elections.

However, in 1970 the headquarters of Chubu Area Development and Improvement (中部圏開発整備本部) announced the termination of the survey after the loss of key members of the alliance: ONO, the vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party, and HIRATA, the mayor of Yokkaichi City, had both passed away, while KITA, the governor of Fukui Prefecture, and the mayor of Tsuruga City, HATAMORI (畑守), continually lost in the elections.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年） - 京都市へ水を供給する琵琶湖疏水開通。
sen.e: 1890: The Lake Biwa Canal to supply water to Kyoto City opened.
1890: The Lake Biwa Canal to supply water to Kyoto City opened.
1890: The Lake Biwa Canal to supply water to Kyoto City opened.

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）7月24日 - 琵琶湖国定公園が指定される。
sen.e: 1950: Lake Biwa and the surrounding area were designated as the Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.
1950: Lake Biwa and the surrounding area were designated as Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.
1950: Lake Biwa and the surrounding area were designated as Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 1964年（昭和39年）9月28日 - 琵琶湖大橋が開通。
sen.e: September 28, 1964: The Biwako Ohashi Bridge opened.
September 28, 1964: The Biwako Ohashi Bridge opened.
September 28, 1964: The Biwako Ohashi Bridge opened.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）9月26日 - 近江大橋有料道路が開通。
sen.e: September 26, 1974: The Omi Ohashi Tollway opened.
September 26, 1974: The Omi Ohashi Tollway opened.
September 26, 1974: The Omi Ohashi Tollway opened.

sen.j: 1980年（昭和55年） - 琵琶湖条例（滋賀県琵琶湖の富栄養化の防止に関する条例）が制定される。
sen.e: 1980: The Lake Biwa Ordinance (the Ordinance for the Prevention of Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) was enacted.
1980: The Lake Biwa Ordinance (the Ordinance for the Prevention of Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) was enacted.
1980: The Lake Biwa Ordinance (the Ordinance for the Prevention of Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) was enacted.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）12月 - 湖沼法における指定湖沼に指定される。
sen.e: 1985: The lake was named as one of the lakes designated by Law Concerning Special Measures for Conservation of Lake Water Quality.
1985: The lake was among those included in the Law Concerning Special Measures for the Conservation of Lake Water Quality.
1985: The lake was among those included in the Law Concerning Special Measures for the Conservation of Lake Water Quality.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年） - ラムサール条約登録湿地に認定される。
sen.e: 1993: The lake was registered as a wetland under the Ramsar Convention
1993: The lake was registered as a wetland under the Ramsar Convention
1993: The lake was registered as a wetland under the Ramsar Convention.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年） - 琵琶湖のレジャー利用適正化条例が施行される。
sen.e: 2003: The Ordinance relating to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa was enacted.
2003: The Ordinance Related to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa was enacted.
2003: The Ordinance Related to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa was enacted.

sen.j: 琵琶湖の生態系は多様で、1000種類を超える動・植物が生息している。
sen.e: Lake Biwa has a biological diversity and is home to more than a thousand species of animals and plants.
Lake Biwa has great biological diversity and is home to more than 1,000 species of animals and plants.
Lake Biwa has great biological diversity and is home to more than 1,000 species of animals and plants.

sen.j: 長い期間自立したためその中には琵琶湖にのみ生息する固有種も数多く確認されている。
sen.e: Among them, there are many species only indigenous to Lake Biwa because the area has been independent for a long time.
Among them, there are many species indigenous to Lake Biwa because the area has been independent for such a long time.
Among them, there are many species indigenous to Lake Biwa because the area has been independent for such a long time.

sen.j: その規模も大きく、独特の漁業が発達した。
sen.e: The scale of them is large, and unique fishery has developed.
The species are large in scale, and a unique fishery has developed.
The species are large in scale, and a unique fishery has developed.

sen.j: その一方で、オオクチバスやブルーギルをはじめとする外来種の侵入や1992年の琵琶湖水位操作規則の改訂、内湖の消失、水田とのネットワークの分断等によって固有の生物相が大きく攪乱を受け、漁獲高が激減した種も多い。
sen.e: On the other hand, the fish catch of many species has been greatly reduced by the disturbance of native species, caused by the invasion of introduced fish such as largemouth bass and bluegill, the amendment of the ordinance on control of water level (琵琶湖水位操作規則の改訂), the loss of lagoons, and the disconnection of the lake from the network of the paddy fields.

On the other hand, the catch of many species has been greatly reduced by the disturbance of native species, caused by the invasion of introduced fish such as the largemouth bass and bluegill, the amendment of the Ordinance on Control of Water Level (琵琶湖水位操作規則の改訂), the loss of lagoons and the disconnection of the lake from the network of paddy fields.

On the other hand, the catches of many species have been significantly reduced by the disturbance of native species, caused by the invasion of introduced fish such as the largemouth bass and bluegill, the amendment of the Ordinance on Control of Water Level (琵琶湖水位操作規則の改訂) in 1992, the loss of lagoons and the disconnection of the lake from the network of paddy fields.

sen.j: それらへの対抗策も講じられ、外来種駆除や生態系に配慮した水位操作、内湖の再生など様々な取り組みが行われているが、まだ十分な効果をあげられていない。
sen.e: Although various actions, for example, removing of introduced species, environmentally-friendly operation of water level control, and restoration of lagoon, have been taken to solve those issues, sufficient results have not been achieved yet.

Although various actions--including the removal of introduced species, environmentally friendly operation of water-level control and restoration of lagoons--have been taken to resolve those issues, sufficient results have not been achieved.

Although various actions--including the removal of introduced species, environmentally friendly operation of water-level control and restoration of lagoons--have been taken to resolve those issues, sufficient results have not been achieved.

sen.j: また、琵琶湖産の稚アユは日本各地へ放流され、そのために琵琶湖固有種が各地で繁殖するという、移入種を生み出す元ともなっている。
sen.e: At the same time, the larvae of ayu hatched in Lake Biwa are released into the local rivers in Japan, and thus Lake Biwa can be a source of introduced species.
At the same time, the larvae of ayu hatched in Lake Biwa are released into the local rivers in Japan, and therefore Lake Biwa can be a source of introduced species.
At the same time, the larvae of ayu hatched in Lake Biwa are released into the local rivers in Japan, and therefore Lake Biwa can be a source of introduced species.

sen.j: 固有種（魚）ビワコオオナマズ（ナマズ科）、イワトコナマズ（ナマズ科）、ホンモロコ（コイ科）、ビワヒガイ（コイ科）、アブラヒガイ（コイ科）
sen.e: Endemic species (fish): Lake Biwa catfish (Siluridae), Biwa rock catfish (Siluridae), willow shiner (Cyprinidae), Biwa oily gudgeon (Cyprinidae), minnow (Cyprinidae)
sen.cmt: 学名でなく英語名でいいのでしょうか。
sen.e: Endemic species (fish): Lake Biwa catfish (Siluridae), Biwa rock catfish (Siluridae), willow shiner (Cyprinidae), Biwa oily gudgeon (Cyprinidae), minnow (Cyprinidae)
Endemic species (fish): Lake Biwa catfish (Siluridae), Biwa rock catfish (Siluridae), willow shiner (Cyprinidae), Biwa oily gudgeon (Cyprinidae), minnow (Cyprinidae)

sen.e: Endemic subspecie: Biwa salmon (Salmonidae)
Endemic subspecie: Biwa salmon (Salmonidae)
Endemic subspecies (fish): Biwa salmon (Salmonidae)

sen.j: 固有種（貝）ビワコミズシタダミ(ミズシタダミ科)、セタシジミ(シジミ科)、ビワカワニナ類(カワニナ科ビワカワニナ属)、オウミガイ(モノアラガイ科)、カドヒラマキガイ(ヒラマキガイ科)、ヒロクチヒラマキガイ(ヒラマキガイ科)
sen.e: Endemic species (Shellfish): Gastropod, Seta clam (Corbiculidae), ビワカワニナ類(カワニナ科ビワカワニナ属), Ohmigai (Lymnaeidae), Kadohiramakigai (Planorbidae), Hirokuchimakigai (Planorbidae)

sen.j: 竹生島（面積0.14km2）、沖島（面積1.5km2）、多景島、沖の白石、矢橋帰帆島がある。
sen.e: There are islands in the lake: Chikubushima Island (area: 0.14 sq. km), Oki-Island (area: 1.5 sq. km), (area: 0.14 sq. km), Oki no Shiraishi (沖の白石), and Yahasekihanto Island.
The lake is home to various islands: Chikubushima (area: 0.14 sq. km), Oki (area: 1.5 sq. km) MISSING NAME (area: 0.14 sq. km), Oki no Shiraishi (沖の白石) and Yabasekihanto.

sen.j: 琵琶湖の環境保全
sen.e: Environmental conservation in Lake Biwa
Environmental conservation in Lake Biwa
Environmental conservation in Lake Biwa

sen.j: 高度成長にともなって湖水の水質汚濁や富栄養化がすすんだ。
sen.e: As the economy grew rapidly, the quality of the lake water degraded and the lake became eutrophic more and more.
As the economy grew rapidly, the lake's water quality degraded and it became increasingly eutrophic.
As the economy grew rapidly, the lake's water quality degraded and it became increasingly eutrophic.

sen.j: このため滋賀県は独自に工業排水と家庭用排水を規制する、いわゆる琵琶湖条例(滋賀県琵琶湖の富栄養化の防止に関する条例)を制定した。
sen.e: Consequently, Shiga Prefecture enacted on its own so called the Lake Biwa Ordinance (the Ordinance for the Prevention of Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) to regulate factory and household effluents.

Consequently, Shiga Prefecture independently enacted the so-called Lake Biwa Ordinance (Ordinance for Prevention of the Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) in order to regulate factory and household effluents.

Consequently, Shiga Prefecture independently enacted the so-called Lake Biwa Ordinance (Ordinance for Prevention of the Eutrophication of Lake Biwa) in order to regulate factory and household effluents.

sen.j: このほかに、琵琶湖に関しては、滋賀県琵琶湖のレジャー利用の適正化に関する条例や、滋賀県琵琶湖のヨシ群落の保全に関する条例、また景観を守るためのふるさと滋賀の風景を守り育てる条例などがある。
sen.e: There are more ordinances enacted on Lake Biwa: for example, the Ordinance relating to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa, the Ordinance of Reed-Community Conservation, and the Ordinance for Protecting and Creating Beautiful Landscape in Homeland Shiga.

There are more ordinances enacted with regard to Lake Biwa: for example, the Ordinance Related to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa, the Ordinance of Reed-Community Conservation, and the Ordinance for Protecting and Creating Beautiful Landscapes in the Shiga Homeland.

There are more ordinances enacted with regard to Lake Biwa: for example, the Ordinance Related to the Appropriate Leisure Usage of Lake Biwa, the Ordinance of Reed-Community Conservation, and the Ordinance for Protecting and Creating Beautiful Landscapes in the Shiga Homeland.

sen.j: また、周辺の工場は地下水をくみ上げ、さらに汚染水地下水浸透禁止の水質汚濁防止法が改正されるまでは、汚染水を意識的に地下に浸透していた工場も多く、琵琶湖周辺の工場地帯の地下水汚染は進んでおり、世界一の閉鎖性水域の琵琶湖の水環境を守るために、早急の対策が必要と言われている。
sen.e: Because factories around Lake Biwa pumped the water out of the ground, and many of them dumped effluents deliberately until the Water Pollution Control Law was amended to prevent them from discharging effluents into the ground, the contamination of underground water in the factory area near the lake have worsened, and some people have urged for quick actions to be taken in order to protect the water in the most closed water area of the world.

Because factories around Lake Biwa pumped the water out of the ground, and many of them dumped effluents deliberately until the Water Pollution Control Law was amended to prevent them from discharging effluents into the ground, the contamination of underground water in the factory area near the lake has worsened, and some people have strongly urged quick action in order to protect the water in what is the world's most enclosed watershed area.

Because factories around Lake Biwa pumped the water out of the ground, and many of them dumped effluents deliberately until the Water Pollution Control Law was amended to prevent them from discharging effluents into the ground, the contamination of underground water in the factory area near the lake has worsened, and some people have strongly urged quick action in order to protect the water in what is the world's most enclosed watershed area.

The following are the municipalities on the shore of Lake Biwa (clockwise from the north):
The following are the municipalities on the shore of Lake Biwa (clockwise from the north):

sen.j: 境界の設定
sen.e: Establishment of borders
Establishment of borders
Establishment of borders

sen.j: 琵琶湖の市町境界については、今までどの市町にも組み入れられていなかったが、沿岸の各自治体で行う共同会議において2007年5月8日に境界の設定に合意し、各自治体の議会の同意を得た上で総務省に届け出を行い、9月28日付で官報に確定が公示された。
sen.e: Municipal borders of Lake Biwa had never been established, but at a joint conference held by the municipalities on the shore of the lake, their delegates reached an agreement to establish the borders of Lake Biwa on May 8, 2007, submitted a document to the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications after the approval of each municipality's assembly, and finally the establishment of the borders was officially announced in the official gazette on September 28.

The municipal borders of Lake Biwa had never been established, but at a joint conference held by the municipalities on the shore of the lake, their delegates reached an agreement to establish the borders of Lake Biwa on May 8, 2007; a document was submitted to the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications after the approval of each municipality's assembly, and finally the establishment of borders was officially announced in the official gazette on September 28.

The municipal borders of Lake Biwa had never been established, but at a joint conference held by the municipalities on the shore of the lake, their delegates reached an agreement to establish the borders of Lake Biwa on May 8, 2007; a document was submitted to the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications after the approval of each municipality's assembly, and finally the establishment of borders was officially announced in the official gazette on September 28.

sen.j: 境界確定の目的は主に地方交付税交付金の増額である。
sen.e: The main purpose of establishing the borders is for each municipality to receive more state subsidies to municipalities.
The main purpose in establishing the borders was that each municipality could receive more of the state subsidies destined for municipalities.
The main purpose in establishing the borders was that each municipality could receive more of the state subsidies destined for municipalities.

sen.j: また、増額された交付金の半分は琵琶湖の保全に使われることが発表されている。
sen.e: Still, the announcement has been made that half of the increased subsidies would be allocated to the conservation of Lake Biwa.
Still, the announcement has been made that half of the increased subsidies would be allocated to the conservation of Lake Biwa.
Still, the announcement has been made that half of the increased subsidies would be allocated to the conservation of Lake Biwa.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Other items
Other items
Others

sen.j: 表記
sen.e: Notation
Notation
Notation

sen.j: 「琵」「琶」が当用漢字・常用漢字外であることから、滋賀県内では平仮名書きにした「びわこ」「びわ湖」という表記も数多く見られる。
sen.e: Since both of the kanji 'bi' and 'wa' are not a daily-use kanji or a kanji for common use, Lake Biwa or 'biwako' is often described in Shiga Prefecture as 'biwako' all in hiragana or 'biwa-ko,' the combination of the first two letters in hiragana and the last one in kanji..

Since neither the kanji for 'bi' and 'wa' is a common or daily form, Lake Biwa (or 'Biwako') is often described in Shiga Prefecture as 'Biwako' all in hiragana or 'Biwa-ko,' which combines the first two letters in hiragana and the last one in kanji.

Since the kanji for 'bi' and 'wa' are not in common use and have not been designated as kanji for daily use, Lake Biwa (or Biwako) is often written in Shiga Prefecture either completely in hiragana (びわこ) or with the first two characters written in hiragana and the last one in kanji (びわ湖).
sen.cmt: neither --- and --- を修正。I think having the kanji included will help the reader a little.

sen.j: かつては「びわ町」という自治体も存在した。
sen.e: There used be a municipality described as 'biwa-cyo' (biwa in hiragana and cyo in kanji).
There used be a municipality described as 'biwa-cyo' ('biwa' in hiragana and 'cyo' in kanji).
There once was a municipality described as 'Biwa-cho' (Biwa in hiragana and cho in kanji).

sen.j: 「びわこ」の例
sen.e: Examples of biwako:
Examples of "Biwako":
Examples of 'びわこ' (Biwako):

sen.j: びわこ銀行、びわこ競艇場、大津びわこ競輪場、MIOびわこ草津、びわこ成蹊スポーツ大学、東びわこ農業協同組合など
sen.e: Biwako Bank, Biwako Kyotei, Otsu Biwako Keirin, MIO Biwako Kusatsu, Biwako Seikei Sports College, JA Higashi Biwako, and so forth
Biwako Bank, Biwako Kyotei, Otsu Biwako Keirin, MIO Biwako Kusatsu, Biwako Seikei Sports College, JA Higashi Biwako, and others
Biwako Bank (びわこ銀行), Biwako Kyotei (びわこ競艇場), Otsu Biwako Keirin (大津びわこ競輪場), MIO Biwako Kusatsu (MIOびわこ草津), Biwako Seikei Sports College (びわこ成蹊スポーツ大学), JA Higashi Biwako (東びわこ農業協同組合), and others
sen.cmt: 日本語表記を追加しました。

sen.j: 「びわ湖」の例
sen.e: Examples of biwa-ko
Examples of "biwa-ko"
Examples of 'びわ湖' (Biwa-ko):

sen.j: びわ湖放送、南びわ湖駅（仮称、旧仮称は「びわこ栗東駅」）など
sen.e: Biwako Broadcasting Co., Ltd., Minami Biwako Station (tentative name, former Biwako Ritto Station)
Biwako Broadcasting Co., Ltd., Minami Biwako Station (tentative name, formerly Biwako Ritto Station)
Biwako Broadcasting Co., Ltd., Minami Biwako Station (tentative name, formerly Biwako Ritto Station), etc.
sen.cmt: The title above says "examples" which kind of suggests that there are more than two instances of "びわ湖" but adding "etc." doesn't result in any grammatical problems so I've added it.On a separate note, I don't really see the distinction being made between "Biwako" and "Biwa-ko" here as the examples provided do not use the form "Biwa-ko" (i.e. with a hyphen).
